page.title: 12INTERVIEW WITH A FARMER
page.content: MY UNCLE, JOHN DUNCAN, FARMS AT RANNACHY. THE FAMILY HAS BEEN THERE 19 YEARS. JOHN DUNCAN WORKS THE 120 ACRE FARM BY HIMSELF. THE FARMER GETS UP AT 7.00. HE FEEDS THE CALVES AND CATTLE, DRESSES POTATOES, TENDS TO THE CROPS AND MACHINERY AND TAKES IN TURNIPS FOR FEEDING THE CATTLE. THE FARM HAS 100 CROSS HEREFORDS AND CROSS CHAROLAIS CATTLE. THEY WERE BOUGHT IN THE ELGIN AND CORNHILL MARTS. HE KEEPS THEM FOR ONE YEAR THEN SELLS THEM FOR BEEF. THE CATTLE EAT GRASS IN SUMMER AND TURNIPS, BARLEY AND HAY IN THE WINTER. MR. DUNCAN LIKES HIS JOB AND ENJOYS FEEDING THE CATTLE BEST. MACHINERY ON THE FARM INCLUDE TRACTORS, A COMBINE HARVESTER, A POTATO DIGGER, AND A TURNIP HARVESTER. { BY LYNDA GRANT.
